Package stars

Class StudentModeController

java.lang.Object
stars.StudentModeController
public class StudentModeController
extends java.lang.Object
Controller class to facilitate the logic for the Student functions

    • inputAddCourse

      public void inputAddCourse​(Student student)
      Student to select from menu which school, which course and which index the student wants to register for Student will only be taken to the addcourse method if index is valid
      Parameters:
      student - student login

    • indexInput

      private Index indexInput​(Course course)
      Print out schedule of index of selected course then ask student to select index
      Parameters:
      course - course selected by student
      Returns:
      index chosen by student

    • addCourse

      public void addCourse​(Student student, java.util.ArrayList<RegisteredCourse> registeredCourses, Course course, Index index)
      Method for student to register for a course
      Parameters:
      student - student object of this student login
      registeredCourses - array list of registered course of this student
      course - course object of course to be registered
      index - index object of index to be registered

    • dropCourse

      public void dropCourse​(Student student, Course course, Index index, RegisteredCourse rc)
      Method for student to drop a registered course
      Parameters:
      student - student object of this student login
      course - course object of course to drop
      index - index object of index to drop
      rc - registered course object of registered course to drop

    • reviewSelection

      private Review reviewSelection​(Student student)
      Displays the list of Reviews that a Student has written and allows the student to select from the list. Used when selecting reviews to edit or delete
      Parameters:
      student - The current student user who is logged in
      Returns:
      The Review selected by the student user

    • reviewCourseSelection

      private Course reviewCourseSelection​(Student student)
      Displays and allows student to select from a list of Courses that the student is eligible to write Reviews for. These include courses that the student has previously taken (pastCourses) and has not yet written a review for. Triggered when student needs to select a course to add review for
      Parameters:
      student - The current student user who is logged in
      Returns:
      The Course selected by the student user to add review for

    • getRec

      private boolean getRec()
      Gets a valid recommendation from the student for a course.
      Returns:
      return true if input is 1, false otherwise

    • filterReview

      private java.lang.String filterReview()
      Gets a review input from the Student and filters the input by replacing the swearwords with * filter() function is used from the Grawlox package to filter the input
      Returns:
      the filtered review

    • addReview

      public void addReview​(Student student)
      Allows student to add a review to one of their past courses and displays the added review once successful
      Parameters:
      student - The student currently logged in

    • editReview

      public void editReview​(Student student)
      Allows student to edit one of the reviews they have previously written Student can either edit the review or the recommendation
      Parameters:
      student - The student currently logged in

    • deleteReview

      public void deleteReview​(Student student)
      Allows student to delete one of the reviews they have previously written
      Parameters:
      student - The student currently logged in

    • displayReviews

      public void displayReviews()
      Allows user to sort courses by number of reviews or percentage recommended. Course information is displayed based on the selction and the student can select one of the courses to view reviews for Then, display the reviews.

    • getTimetable

      public void getTimetable​(java.util.ArrayList<StudyGroup> studyGroups)
      Prints the timetable for a student.
      Parameters:
      studyGroups - ArrayList of studyGroups of the student

    • checkClash

      private boolean checkClash​(Index index, java.util.ArrayList<StudyGroup> studyGroups)
      Check for clashes in timetable: Compares whether there exists an overlapping range and prints all clashes.
      Parameters:
      index - The new index to check clash for
      studyGroups - ArrayList of registered studyGroups of the student
      Returns:
      true if there is clash, false otherwise

    • updateVacancies

      private void updateVacancies​(java.lang.String cCode, int n)
      Change vacancies in a course by n
      Parameters:
      cCode - course code of course to update
      n - addition or subtraction of vacancies by this amount
